Cool UI and performance. Would love if the app chrome used a native title bar. Also would be nice to cycle wallpapers automatically
Easy to use app to change wallpaper. Attractive UI.
It is a super great way to find really good photos.
Great pictures but it I need the option that automatically changes my background based on my last search or preferences.

I like the app and what it has to offer, ease of use, convenience, and high quality images.

The problem: What you see is not what you get. Wallpapers do not follow any ratio standards and on a GNOME DE, all of the wallpapers are Zoom adjusted. Most of the time, the oddly sized wallpapers are cut off and you will likely never see the whole image. Wallpapers should adhere to standard monitor ratios, in my opinion.

The second problem I had is that the categories are a bit too general. Art, for example, is an enormous umbrella and I don't want to look through hundreds of photos of Frescoes when I want something abstract. 

All in all, solid wallpaper app for the undemanding crowd, but lacks features for those of us who are more picky.
summary: Nice app, implementation needs some improvement

description: This is really cool. But, it would be nice if it actually set the background to the picture it downloads. All it does is download the picture. Then I have to go to the background app and select that picture as an extra step. It seems unnecessary.
Great photos for backgrounds!
Wont show Images, just keep showing errors.

Thank you for developing this app. Suggestion: If you could include a link to the photo's original webpage and a like button in the app itself, I guess that'd be beneficial to the content's original creator. Cheers!

Would not recommend. Filled with advertisements for covid 19. Every other picture is titled "UN response to covid 19...". I'd advise the author to change the sources to something less gloomy and political.
summary: The whole app looks like an ad campaign for covid19

description: I love the collection and quality of wallpapers here. They are second to none. If possible, auto changing would be great. Other than that, I am not able to see past the first few wallpapers. No infinity, unless it's user error and I'm missing something.

description: good app found lots of quality wallpaper
summary: good app found lots of quality wallpaper

description: I think it is a great app so far. I really wish it had an interval change option. I am trying to use another app to periodically change the background, but I can't find where Fondo is storing the images. It is suppose to be /.local/share/backgrounds according to the Forums but that folder is empty. If you were able to download multiple files and change them without having to go through the hassle of finding the images in Fondo every time you wanted to change your background, it would be a really great app. I have search my Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and can not find any of the images that Fondo downloaded.

The app is both good looking and well functioning.
The only drawback is that it forces ElementaryOS look-and-feel, and I'm on Fedora right now, so it's a bit out of context
By far one of my favorite apps in Linux! Thank you for creating and keep updating it!
Very neat interface and beautiful images.
Thanks Developers and Fedora Team :*
I really love elementary os apps on flatpak.
It's a great app but it doesn't work for KDE.
Very practical, intuitive, fast and high quality wallpapers. And all without complexity. I do not recommend using it in the xfce environment because it is not working.
Fast and responsive apps with beautiful wallpaper. I think this apps must be installed on all Ubuntu OS

I like the search feature and how quickly the image downloaded and updated the background. Wouldn't mind if they added a few additional features such as adjusting how the background screen appears such as spanning across multiple screens or independent backgrounds on different screens. Otherwise I like what it does and how it does it.
summary: A great way to add functionality and beauty to GNOME

Under Fedo33 it was great. I would give it a 5. However, now with Fedo34 I am getting this error on Gnome 40: "Error while getting peer-to-peer dbus connection: Could not connect: No such file or directory. So, still some adjustments needed. "

Gorgeous wallpaper at your fingertips. Select from thousands of wallpaper from every genre you can imagine. Just find and click, instant wallpaper. Works great paired with Zorin Appearance in selecting the theme color and whether you want a light background or black with color highlights. Excellent app.

Fondo works and looks great. Right now, 11 may 2021, it doesn't work on Gnome 40, but that's not a good reason to give the developer 1 star, as other people here are doing... They are already working on it, have patience and be grateful 

Good job!

description: Its downloading the wallpaper and placing in set wallpaper menu in settings, but it is not automatically changing the wallpaper as it used to do. (Using RPM version)

Very smooth App and amazing experience. I am using nothing else to choose Wallpapers since I installed this. But I miss the opportunity to set the Adjustment to "Wallpaper" like in the gnome-tweaks menu so the wallpaper is filling all Screens.

The Problem which I have because this feature is missing is: Always when the Wallpaper changes no matter if manual or caused by the slideshow, I would have to set the Adjustment in gnome-tweaks. Maybe I will find a workaround for this problem by telling gnome to always use this adjustment setting as default so always when it resets because the image changes it resets do the Wallpaper adjustment.

to fix error message "Error copy from URL to directory"
see this issue: https://github.com/calo001/fondo/issues/154

```
For those who don't want to install an extra software to fix the problem, here's the command line version of the "fix":
flatpak override com.github.calo001.fondo --filesystem=xdg-run/gvfsd
```
